forumNotes.author: karyonix
forumNotes.content:
> The drive should have been drive C but i dont know why its drive D

Because Windows text mode setup assign drive letter C: to your USB stick.   
When you create new partition in SSD, next available drive letter is D:, so it become D:.   

If you want new partition to be C:, assign other driver letter to USB stick before you use it to boot text mode setup.   
Modify **\\$WIN_NT$.\~BT\\migrate.inf** in USB stick. Add value "\\DosDevices\\U:" for usb stick and delete "\\DosDevices\\C:".  

```
[Addreg]

HKLM,"SYSTEM\MountedDevices","\DosDevices\U:",0x00030001,\

	 11,22,33,44,00,7e,00,00,00,00,00,00
```

The value data is composed of 4-byte MBR signature and 8-byte offset of partition, make sure it match your USB stick.
